name: reflaxe-elixir
description: Haxe to Elixir compilation target using Reflaxe with Mix integration. Uses npm/lix for Haxe compiler development, mix for Elixir runtime testing.
author: Claude Code

scripts.build: echo 'Reflaxe.Elixir is a compiler - no build step needed'
scripts.test:sequential: make -C test -j1 && npm run test:generator && npm run test:mix
scripts.test:mix: MIX_ENV=test mix deps.compile && MIX_ENV=test mix test --max-cases 1 --timeout 120000
scripts.test:core: make -C test test-example_01_simple && make -C test test-basic_syntax && make -C test test-liveview_basic
scripts.test:mix-parallel: MIX_ENV=test mix deps.compile && MIX_ENV=test mix test --max-cases 4 --timeout 120000
scripts.test:examples: for dir in examples/*/; do echo "Testing $dir"; if [ -f "$dir/compile-all.hxml" ]; then (cd "$dir" && npx haxe compile-all.hxml) || exit 1; elif [ -f "$dir/build.hxml" ]; then (cd "$dir" && npx haxe build.hxml) || exit 1; fi; done
scripts.test:verify: npm run test:core && echo 'Core functionality verified âœ…'
scripts.setup: lix scope create && lix install haxelib:reflaxe
